data.title: US condemns Iran death sentence on marine for alleged spying
data.meta_description: The Obama administration has condemned a death sentence passed by an Iranian revolutionary court on a former US marine yesterday, angrily dismissing charges that he is a spy.  The White House said it
data.text:
The Obama administration has condemned a death sentence passed by an Iranian revolutionary court on a former US marine yesterday, angrily dismissing charges that he is a spy.

The White House said it was seeking confirmation of the sentence on Amir Mirza Hekmati, 28, who has dual US and Iranian citizenship, but continued: “If true, we strongly condemn such a verdict and will work with our partners to convey our condemnation to the Iranian government.”

It denied Mr Hekmati was a spy. “The Iranian regime has a history of falsely accusing people of being spies, of eliciting forced confessions, and of holding innocent Americans for political reasons,”

Tommy Vietor, the national security spokesman, said. The Islamic Republic’s confrontation with the West escalated further as western
